ratio.description: The aspect ratio expressed as a decimal number with two decimal points of precision. For example, 1.78 represents 16:9, and 1.33 represents 4:3.

tag.description: The aspect ratio represented as a tag. Common examples include 16:9, 4:3, and 2.35:1.

FrameRate.description: Represents the frame rate of a video, expressed in frames per second (FPS).

frameRate.description: The frame rate expressed as a decimal number with three decimal points of precision. Common values include 30, 29.97, 25, and 23.976.

rational.description: The frame rate expressed as a rational number. For example, 30000:1001 represents 29.97 FPS.

VideoMetadata.description: Metadata describing the properties and characteristics of a video file.

containerName.description: The short name of the video container format. Examples include mov, mxf, mp4, and mpegts.

longContainerName.description: The full name of the video container format. Examples include MPEG-4, QuickTime / MOV, and MPEG-TS (MPEG-2 Transport Stream).

codecName.description: The short name of the codec used for video encoding. Examples include h264, prores, dnxhd, mpeg2, hevc, xdcam, and ffv1.

longCodecName.description: The full name of the codec used for video encoding. Examples include H.264 / AVC / MPEG-4 AVC / MPEG-4 part 10, H.265 / HEVC (High Efficiency Video Coding), and MPEG-2 video.
examples: H.264 / AVC / MPEG-4 AVC / MPEG-4 part 10

pixelFormatName.description: The name of the pixel format used in the video. Examples include yuv420p, yuv422p, yuv444p, yuv420p10le, yuv422p10le, and yuv444p10le.

primaryBitDepth.description: The number of bits per pixel used to represent the color information. Examples include 8, 10, and 12.

frameWidth.description: The width of the video frame in pixels. Examples include 1920, 1280, and 720.

frameHeight.description: The height of the video frame in pixels. Examples include 1080, 720, and 480.

displayAspectRatio.description: The display aspect ratio of the video.

scanning.description: The scanning type of the video, indicating whether it is progressive or interlaced.

averageFrameRate.description: The average frame rate of the video in frames per second.

durationInMillis.description: The duration of the video in milliseconds. Examples include 30000 for a 30-second video.

totalFrames.description: The total number of frames in the video. Examples include 900 for a 30-second video at 30 fps.

size.description: The total size of the video file in bytes. Examples include 10485760 for a 10 MB video file.

videoStreamSize.description: The size of the video stream in bytes, excluding audio and metadata. Examples include 10485760 for a 10 MB video stream.

colorRangeName.description: The name of the color range used in the video.

colorSpaceName.description: The name of the color space used in the video.

colorTransferName.description: The name of the color transfer function used in the video.

colorPrimariesName.description: The name of the color primaries used in the video.

hdrStandardName.description: The name of the HDR standard used in the video, if applicable.

VideoScanning.description: Represents the scanning information of a video, including metadata and heuristic analysis.

metadata.description: The scanning information extracted from the video's metadata.

heuristics.description: The scanning information determined through a deep analysis of video segments.

Scanning.description:
Specifies the scanning type of a video. Examples include:
 - `PROGRESSIVE`: Video frames are displayed sequentially.
 - `INTERLACED_TOP_FIRST`: Interlaced video with the top field displayed first.
 - `INTERLACED_BOTTOM_FIRST`: Interlaced video with the bottom field displayed first.

VideoIngestion.description: Details the ingestion process of a video, including its state, metadata, and quality assessment.

ingestionState.description: The state of the video ingestion process.

metadata.description: The metadata extracted during the ingestion process.

qualityAssessment.description: The quality assessment results of the ingested video.

VideoIngestionState.description: Represents the state of the video ingestion process, including status and progress indicators.

updatedAt.description: The date and time of the last update to the ingestion state.

etaSeconds.description: The estimated time remaining for ingestion completion, in seconds.

ingestionStatus.description: The current status of the ingestion process.

webVideoAvailable.description: Indicates if a web-compatible video format is available.

thumbnailsAvailable.description: Indicates if thumbnails have been generated for the video.

fullFramesAvailable.description: Indicates if full-frame images have been generated for the video.

videoMetadataAvailable.description: Indicates if the metadata for the video has been extracted and is available.

progressPercentage.description: The progress of the ingestion process, expressed as a percentage.

VideoOutput.description: Represents the output details of a video.

state.description: Details about the current state of the video output process, if applicable.

VideoOutputState.description: Provides information about the state of a video output process, including status and progress indicators.

updatedAt.description: The date and time of the last update to the output state.

status.description: The current status of the video output process.

progressPercentage.description: The progress of the output process, expressed as a percentage.

errorMessage.description: A description of the error encountered when the status is `FAILED`.

VideoProcessing.description: Represents the processing details of a video, including its state, source video, and applied processing options.

processingState.description: The current state of the video processing operation.

sourceVideo.description: Information about the source video used for processing.

options.description: The configuration options applied to the video processing.

VideoProcessingState.description: Details the state of the video processing operation, including status, progress, and estimated completion time.

updatedAt.description: The date and time of the last update to the processing state.

etaSeconds.description: The estimated time remaining for processing completion, in seconds.

processingStatus.description: The current status of the video processing operation.

progressPercentage.description: The progress of the processing operation, expressed as a percentage.

Percentage.description: A percentage value represented as an integer. Commonly used to denote progress or completion levels. E.g., 0, 50, 100.

VideoQualityAssessment.description: Evaluates the overall quality of the video, including detailed metrics and an overall subjective score.

metrics.description: A list of quality metrics evaluated for the video.

overallSubjectiveScore.description: The overall subjective quality score of the video, on a scale from 0 to 5. Higher scores generally indicate better quality.

FileName.description: The name of the file, including its extension. E.g., myvideo.mp4.

VideoFile.description: Represents metadata about a video file, including its name, size, type, and container details.

name.description: The name of the video file, including its extension. E.g., myvideo.mp4.

size.description: The size of the video file in bytes. For example, 10485760 bytes for a 10 MB file.

type.description: The MIME type of the video file. E.g., video/mp4, video/quicktime, video/mp2t.

containerName.description: The container format of the video file. E.g., MPEG-2 Transport Stream, MPEG-4, QuickTime.

lastModified.description: The last modified date and time of the video file.

VideoInStatus.description: Information about the upload and ingestion process of a master video.

videoId.description: The unique identifier of the video being processed.

VideoProcessingStatus.description: Information regarding the current processing state of a video.

videoId.description: The unique identifier of the video being processed.

VideoDownloadUrl.description: Details about the video download URL.

videoId.description: The unique identifier of the video for which the download URL is generated.

presignedUrl.description: The pre-signed URL used for downloading the video.

expiresAt.description: Date and time for when the pre-signed URL will expire, based on the server's clock.

fileSize.description: The size of the video file in bytes.

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the video file, such as video/mp4 or video/quicktime.

fileExtension.description: The file extension of the video file, such as mp4 or mov.

suggestedFileName.description: Suggested name for the video file, including its extension. E.g., myvideo.mp4.

crc32cChecksum.description: The CRC32C checksum of the video file, if known, represented as a 32-bit unsigned integer.

VideoComparisonLink.description: Details about the video comparison link.

link.description: The URL link used for comparing the source and target videos.

leftVideoId.description: The unique identifier of the left video in the comparison.

rightVideoId.description: The unique identifier of the right video in the comparison.

VideoOutStatus.description: Details about the most recent output operation performed on a video.

videoId.description: The unique identifier of the video being processed.

VideoUpload.description: Metadata and details about the upload process of a master video.

VideoUploadState.description: Represents the current state of a master video upload process.

updatedAt.description: The date and time of the most recent update to the upload state.

uploadStatus.description: The current status of the upload operation.

progressPercentage.description: The progress of the upload operation as a percentage.

error.description: Details about any error encountered during the upload process, applicable when the `uploadStatus` is `FAILED`.

code.description: The error code indicating the specific issue.

message.description: A human-readable message explaining the error code.

details.description: Additional details about the error, if available.

OperationStatus.description: The operational status of an upload, ingestion, processing, or output activity.

PixelFormat.description: The pixel format of the video. If not explicitly specified, the output video will inherit the pixel format of the source video. The pixel format defines the chroma subsampling, bit depth, and format name for encoding and processing.

name.description:
The name of the pixel format used in the video. Examples include yuv420p, yuv422p, and yuv444p.
The pixel format is closely related to chroma subsampling and determines how color information is stored.

ChromaSubsamplingYUV.description:
The chroma subsampling format used in YUV color encoding. Chroma subsampling reduces the amount of color information in favor of luminance data, optimizing for human visual perception.
Common formats:
  - 4:2:0: Reduces color resolution significantly, commonly used in consumer video.
  - 4:2:2: Maintains more color data, often used in broadcast applications.
  - 4:4:4: Retains full color resolution, used in professional workflows.

BitDepthEnum.description:
Specifies the number of bits used to represent the color of a single pixel in a video. Higher bit depths allow for more precise color representation and greater dynamic range.
Common values:
  - 8 bits: Standard for many video formats, supporting up to 256 color values per channel.
  - 10 bits: Used for HDR and professional workflows, supporting up to 1024 color values per channel.
  - 12 bits: Used in advanced workflows, providing up to 4096 color values per channel.

Error.description: Represents an error response returned by the API. Provides details such as the error code, status, and any associated validation errors.

timestamp.description: The date and time indicating when the error occurred.

requestId.description: The unique identifier for the request that caused the error.

requestPath.description: The API path that was accessed when the error occurred.

errorCode.description: A code representing the specific error.

errorCodeEnum.description: If present, the `errorCode` corresponds to one of Pixop’s documented error codes.

message.description: A human-readable message explaining the error.

statusCode.description: The HTTP status code associated with the error.

validationErrors.description: A list of validation errors, if any.

errorDetails.description: Additional details about the error, if available.

ErrorField.description: The field in the request that caused the error.

ValidationError.description: Represents a validation error for a specific field in the request. Provides details about the field, the invalid value, and the error message.

value.description: The invalid value provided for the field.

message.description: A human-readable message explaining the validation error.

ErrorCodeEnum.description:
Enumerates the known error codes returned by the API.
Not all possible codes are listed here, and additional codes may be introduced in the future.
When present, these values correspond to well-defined application or HTTP errors.

x-enumDescriptions.ACCOUNT_DISABLED: Account is disabled or API key is not active
x-enumDescriptions.TEAM_NOT_FOUND: Team not found. Either the team does not exist, is not apiEnabled, or the authenticated ApiUser does not have access to it.
x-enumDescriptions.CONTAINER_IS_NOT_SUPPORTED_FOR_SELECTED_: Container is not supported for selected codec
x-enumDescriptions.PROJECT_WITH_VIDEOS_CANNOT_BE_DELETED: Project with videos cannot be deleted
x-enumDescriptions.ACTIVE_API_KEY_CANNOT_BE_DELETED: Active API key cannot be deleted
x-enumDescriptions.VIDEO_ALREADY_BEING_COPIED_TO_OUTPUT_LOC: Video is already being copied to an output location
x-enumDescriptions.ONGOING_COPY_TO_OUTPUT_NEEDS_TO_BE_RESTA: Video is already being copied to an output location. Needs to be restarted or abandoned.
x-enumDescriptions.KEY_NOT_FOUND: The given key does not exist in the bucket
x-enumDescriptions.CONTENT_RANGE_HEADER_INVALID: Content-Range header invalid or not found
x-enumDescriptions.MAXIMUM_AMOUNT_OF_ACTIVE_API_KEYS_REACHE: Maximum amount of active API keys reached
x-enumDescriptions.MAXIMUM_AMOUNT_OF_ACTIVE_WEBHOOKS_REACHE: Maximum amount of active webhooks reached
x-enumDescriptions.TARGET_RESOLUTION_OUT_OF_ALLOWED_RANGE: Target resolution out of allowed range
x-enumDescriptions.TARGET_RESOLUTION_CANNOT_BE_LOWER_THAN_C: Target resolution cannot be lower than calculated aspect ratio resolution
x-enumDescriptions.MISSING_CUSTOM_RESOLUTION: Width and height must be provided when tag and aspectRatioTag are not
x-enumDescriptions.VIDEO_IN_RESTART_CHECKSUM_MISMATCH: Cannot restart a VideoInOperation that failed due to checksum mismatch without also setting skipChecksumValidation to true

PageNumber.description: The current page number in the paginated result set. Starts at 0.

PageSize.description: The number of items per page in a paginated result set.

Page.description: Represents the pagination details for a result set.

numberOfElements.description: The number of items on the current page.

totalPages.description: The total number of pages available for the resource.

totalElements.description: The total number of items available for the resource.

allOf.description: Represents a paginated list of API keys.

items.description: The list of API keys for the current page.

allOf.description: Represents a paginated list of webhooks.

items.description: The list of webhooks for the current page.

allOf.description: Represents a paginated list of webhook events.

items.description: The list of webhook events for the current page.

allOf.description: Represents a paginated list of billing periods.

items.description: The list of billing periods for the current page.

allOf.description: Represents a paginated list of transactions, including associated billing period details and aggregated totals.

billingPeriod.description: The billing period associated with the transactions on this page.

totals.description: Aggregated totals for all transactions within the billing period.

items.description: The list of transactions included on the current page.

allOf.description: Represents a paginated list of S3 input locations.

items.description: The list of S3 input locations for the current page.

allOf.description: Represents a paginated list of S3 output locations.

items.description: The list of S3 output locations for the current page.

allOf.description: Represents a paginated list of teams.

items.description: The list of teams for the current page.

allOf.description: Represents a paginated list of projects.

items.description: The list of projects for the current page.

allOf.description: Represents a paginated list of video processing configurations.

items.description: The list of video processing configurations for the current page.

allOf.description: Represents a paginated list of videos.

items.description: The list of videos for the current page.

EncodingProfileEnum.description:
The encoding profile used in the video encoding process, controlling the media container, codec, chroma subsampling, and bitrate.

If `encodingProfile` is set, `encodingConfiguration` should not be specified.

Available profiles:

**Apple ProRes**
- `PRORES_422_LT`: Apple ProRes 422 (LT)

EncodingConfiguration.description:
Configuration options for encoding a video, allowing detailed control over the encoding process. 
Should not be used in conjunction with `encodingProfile`.

codec.description: The codec used for video encoding.

pixelFormat.description: The pixel format for the encoded video.

bitrate.description: The target bitrate for the video encoding.

MediaContainerEnum.description: The container format of the video, determining its media encapsulation. Examples include MOV (QuickTime), MXF (Material Exchange Format), MP4 (MPEG-4), and MPEGTS (MPEG-2 Transport Stream).

CodecEnum.description: The codec used for video compression and encoding. Examples include H264 (H.264 / AVC), MPEG-2 (MPEG-2 video), HEVC (H.265 / HEVC), XDCAM (Sony XDCAM HD422), and FFV1 (FF Video Codec 1).

Bitrate.description: The target bitrate for video encoding, measured in bits per second. For example, 1,000,000 bps corresponds to a bitrate of 1 Mbps. If unspecified, an appropriate value is automatically computed based on the source video and target resolution.

QualityMetric.description: Represents a quality metric for video assessment, including detailed and subjective scoring information.

name.description: The name of the quality metric, such as noise, details, or colors.

sampleMean.description: The sample mean value of the quality metric. For example, 0.377.

subjectiveLabel.description: The subjective label of the quality metric, such as poor, good, or untenable.

subjectiveScore.description: The subjective numerical score for the quality metric. For example, 3.726.

StartPositionMilliseconds.description: The start position of the source video for processing, in milliseconds.

EndPositionMilliseconds.description: The end position of the source video for processing, in milliseconds. Must be at least 1000 milliseconds.

SourceVideo.description: Defines the start and end positions of the source video used in processing.

SortDirectionEnum.description:
Specifies the direction in which to sort the results.
- `ASC`: ascending
- `DESC`: descending

SortByBaseEnum.description:
Specifies the field by which to sort the results.
- `createdAt`: Sort by creation date.
- `updatedAt`: Sort by last updated date.

FilterModeEnum.description: Defines the mode of filtering applied to results. Default is `INCLUDE`.

HttpsURL.description:
A URL that must use HTTPS and point to a publicly reachable address. Only port 443 is allowed for HTTPS URLs.
The following addresses are not allowed:
- Loopback (e.g., 127.x.x.x, ::1)
- Site-local (RFC1918) addresses (e.g., 10.x.x.x, 192.168.x.x, 172.16–31.x.x, IPv6 unique-local)
- Link-local addresses (e.g., 169.254.x.x, fe80::/10)
- Multicast addresses (e.g., 224.0.0.0–239.255.255.255, ff00::/8)

The server will parse the URL, resolve its host, and reject any internal or non-public address.

CRC32C.description:
The CRC-32C checksum of a video file, represented as a 32-bit unsigned integer, used to verify data integrity. 
For more information, see [RFC 3720](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3720.txt).

S3ObjectKey.description: The object key of a video in an S3 bucket. For example, `src/myvideo.mp4`.

S3ObjectKeyPrefix.description:
The object key prefix for the video in the S3 bucket. 
When the video is copied to the bucket, its file name is prefixed with this value to create the `objectKey` for the video in the bucket. 
For example, if `S3ObjectKeyPrefix=myoutputs` and `fileName=myvideo.mp4`, the `objectKey` becomes `myoutputs/myvideo.mp4`.

IdPathParam.name: id
IdPathParam.description: The unique identifier for the object.

VideoId.name: videoId
VideoId.description: The unique identifier for the video.

TargetVideoId.name: targetVideoId
TargetVideoId.description: The unique identifier for the target video.

SkipChecksumValidation.name: skipChecksumValidation
SkipChecksumValidation.description:
Specifies whether to skip checksum validation for the completion of the "video in" operation. 
This is useful when restarting a "video in" operation that was initiated with an incorrect checksum and has failed because of that.

InputLocationId.name: inputLocationId
InputLocationId.description: The unique identifier for the input location.

OutputLocationId.name: outputLocationId
OutputLocationId.description: The unique identifier for the output location.

VideoProcessingConfigurationId.name: confId
VideoProcessingConfigurationId.description: The unique identifier for the video processing configuration.

VideoProcessingAppraisalId.name: appraisalId
VideoProcessingAppraisalId.description: The unique identifier for the video processing appraisal.

Crc32c.name: crc32c
Crc32c.description: Optional CRC32C checksum of the video file, used for data integrity verification.

DurationMinutes.name: durationMinutes
DurationMinutes.description: The duration, in minutes, for which the pre-signed URL will be valid.

MaxConcurrentConnections.name: maxConcurrentConnections
MaxConcurrentConnections.description: The maximum number of concurrent connections allowed for this import.

SelectTeamId.name: selectTeamId
SelectTeamId.description:
Specifies the team ID for the operation. 
- For `POST` requests, assigns the new object to the specified team.
- For `GET` requests, retrieves data for the specified team.
If not provided, defaults to the ID of the default team associated with the API key.

FilterByTeamId.name: teamId
FilterByTeamId.description: Filters results by the specified team ID.

FilterByProjectId.name: projectId
FilterByProjectId.description: Filters results by the specified project ID. Includes only videos with the given project ID.

FilterByFromDate.name: fromDate
FilterByFromDate.description: Filters results by creation date. Includes only items created at or after the specified date. Defaults to the creation date of the team.

FilterByToDate.name: toDate
FilterByToDate.description: Filters results by creation date. Includes only items created at or before the specified date. Defaults to the current date.

FilterEndedMode.name: endedMode
FilterEndedMode.description:
Filters results based on the ended mode:
- `INCLUDE`: Includes ended billing periods in the result.
- `EXCLUDE`: Excludes ended billing periods from the result.
- `ONLY`: Only returns ended billing periods in the result.

FilterProcessingTransactionsMode.name: processingTransactionsMode
FilterProcessingTransactionsMode.description:
Filters results based on the processing transactions mode:
- `INCLUDE`: Includes processing transactions in the result.
- `EXCLUDE`: Excludes processing transactions from the result.
- `ONLY`: Only returns processing transactions in the result.

FilterByVideoId.name: videoId
FilterByVideoId.description: Filters results to include only those transactions that are associated with the specified `videoId`.

FilterByMasterVideoId.name: masterVideoId
FilterByMasterVideoId.description: Filters results to include only videos derived from the specified `masterVideoId`.

FilterByClipId.name: clipId
FilterByClipId.description: Filters results to include only videos whose `clipId` matches the specified value.

FilterClipMode.name: clipMode
FilterClipMode.description:
Filters results based on the clip mode:
- `INCLUDE`: Includes clips in the result.
- `EXCLUDE`: Excludes clips from the result.
- `ONLY`: Only returns clips in the result.

FilterBuiltInMode.name: builtInMode
FilterBuiltInMode.description:
Filters results based on the built-in mode:
- `INCLUDE`: Includes built-in configurations in the result.
- `EXCLUDE`: Excludes built-in configurations from the result.
- `ONLY`: Only returns built-in configurations in the result.

FullIngestion.name: fullIngestion
FullIngestion.description:
Determines the ingestion level:
- `false`: Only metadata is ingested. Thumbnails, web video artifacts, quality assessments, and deep scanning type analysis are not performed. This mode is suitable for third-party integrations that process videos in an ephemeral manner.
- `true`: Full ingestion is performed, including metadata, thumbnails, web video artifacts, quality assessments, and deep scanning analysis. This mode is used for videos that need to be available on the web application.

FilterSuccessfulMode.name: successfulMode
FilterSuccessfulMode.description:
Filters results based on the successful mode:
- `INCLUDE`: Includes successful events in the result.
- `EXCLUDE`: Excludes successful events from the result.
- `ONLY`: Only returns successful events in the result.

FilterTestMode.name: testMode
FilterTestMode.description:
Filters results based on the test mode:
- `INCLUDE`: Includes test events in the result.
- `EXCLUDE`: Excludes test events from the result.
- `ONLY`: Only returns test events in the result.

FilterByOccurredAtFrom.name: occurredAtFrom
FilterByOccurredAtFrom.description:
Filters results by the occurredAt date and time.  
Includes only items where the occurredAt value is greater than or equal to the specified date-time (inclusive).

FilterByOccurredAtUntil.name: occurredAtUntil
FilterByOccurredAtUntil.description:
Filters results by the occurredAt date and time.  
Includes only items where the occurredAt value is strictly less than the specified date-time (exclusive).

VideoNameParam.name: videoName
VideoNameParam.description: Specifies the name of the video. If not provided, the name will be derived from the source video.

StartPositionMillisecondsParam.name: startPosMs
StartPositionMillisecondsParam.description:
Specifies the start position of the source video for processing, in milliseconds. Defaults to the start of the source video. 
Providing a value greater than `(source video duration or EndPositionMillisecondsParam) - 1000` results in a `400 Bad Request` response.

EndPositionMillisecondsParam.name: endPosMs
EndPositionMillisecondsParam.description:
Specifies the end position of the source video for processing, in milliseconds. Defaults to the end of the source video.
- If the specified value exceeds the source video duration, it will be adjusted to match the end of the source video.
- Providing a value smaller than `(StartPositionMillisecondsParam + 1000)` results in a `400 Bad Request` response.

PageNumberParam.name: pageNumber
PageNumberParam.description: Specifies the current page number, starting at 0.

PageSizeParam.name: pageSize
PageSizeParam.description: Specifies the number of items per page.

SortByBaseParam.name: sortBy
SortByBaseParam.description: Specifies the field to sort the results by.

SortDirectionParam.name: sortDirection
SortDirectionParam.description:
Specifies the sort direction for the results:
- `ASC`: ascending order.
- `DESC`: descending order.

ApiKeyPostRequest.description: Fields required for creating a new API key.

WebhookPatchRequest.description: Fields of a webhook that can be updated.

WebhookPostRequest.description: Fields required for creating a webhook.

S3OutputLocationPatchRequest.description: Fields of an S3 output location that can be updated.

S3OutputLocationPostRequest.description: Fields required for creating a new S3 output location.

ProjectPatchRequest.description: Fields of a project that can be updated.

ProjectPostRequest.description: Fields required for creating a new project.

VideoDeleteRequest.description: A list of derived video IDs expected to be deleted. An empty list indicates no derived videos are expected to be deleted.

CreateMasterVideoFromS3Request.description: Parameters required for importing a video from an S3 bucket into the Pixop Platform.

CreateMasterVideoFromS3BucketRequest.description: Parameters required for importing a video from a specified S3 bucket into the Pixop Platform.

CopyVideoToS3Request.description: Parameters required for exporting a video from the Pixop Platform into an S3 bucket.

CopyVideoToS3BucketRequest.description: Parameters required for exporting a video from the Pixop Platform into a specified S3 bucket.

VideoProcessingConfigurationRequest.description: Request payload for creating a `VideoProcessingConfiguration` object, specifying the desired processing settings.

VideoProcessingRequest.description: Request payload for processing a video, defining the configuration options and processing filters to apply.

BadRequest.description: Invalid request. Inspect the details of the error for more information.

Unauthorized.description: Authentication failed. Missing or invalid `X-API-Key` or basic authentication credentials.

WWW-Authenticate.description: The authentication method that should be used to gain access to the resource.

Forbidden.description: Access denied. You do not have the necessary permissions to access this resource.

NotFound.description: The requested resource could not be found.

Conflict.description: Conflict detected. The request could not be processed due to conflicting data.

TooManyRequests.description: Too Many Requests. The rate limit for this resource has been exceeded.

InternalServerError.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server.

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: The maximum number of requests allowed per minute.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests remaining in the current rate limit window.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The number of seconds until the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying a request that failed due to rate limits.

basic_auth.description:
Basic HTTP authentication using an email and password. The `Authorization` header must be set as:
  - `Authorization: Basic <base64-encoded-credentials>`
Where `<base64-encoded-credentials>` is the Base64 encoding of `email:password`.
Example:
  - `Authorization: Basic dXNlckBleGFtcGxlLmNvbTpwYXNzd29yZA==`

api_key.name: X-API-Key
api_key.description:
API key authentication using the `X-API-Key` header. 
Provide the API key as part of the request headers:
  - `X-API-Key: <your-api-key>`
Example:
  - `X-API-Key: gTF1d6iQKyu8gzXO4pNCt10WlTjhKzrWtUm1wwTGuMA`
